file_content.text: Thanks to you, productivity's through the roof.
I took care of your workers. Their revolt should quiet down.
I'm not one for thank-yous, but... thank you.
To celebrate this moment, the board put something together. A token of our friendship, with you and with the Empire.
Horizon Enterprises won't tolerate insubordination.
My lord, what an honor, really, from the bottom of my heart.
Pleasure, officer. Always glad to speak with our Imperial overseers.
A bounty hunter, yes? Exciting. Pleased to meet you.
Welcome, pleased to meet you. Have a seat--sorry, old habits die hard.
I'm Erin Kaldo, Senior Executive President of Horizon Enterprises. Proud partner with the Empire since the initial invas--occupation.
It's refreshing to meet a Corellian who's on our side.
Pleased to meet you.
Customers are afraid of change. Give them time, push your selling points and they'll come around.
I'm not officially with the Imps, so you don't have to suck up to me.
Relax, lady.
If you don't mind, I'd prefer to keep this professional.
You seem anxious.
I hate excuses, but yes, the company's... distressed.
You're actually the president? Of an entire company?
Who put a woman in charge?
My leadership's secured record profits since my male predecessor passed away. Heart trouble, young, tragic.
Sometimes it feels like the galaxy's run by men.
Good to see a woman in charge.
Men aren't cut out for business. Mother issues, crippling insecurities, no real insight into the human condition.
Now I'm proud to say Horizon Enterprises is adjusting spectacularly to the Corellian transition. Upper management, Board of Directors, all ecstatic.
Unfortunately, well, it's our workforce. Ungrateful little... they want, no, they "demand" we sever our Imperial ties. We refused, and they revolted!
Make an example of your strongest workers, and they'll obey once more.
You must punish them swiftly.
You read my mind, my lord.
This is what happens when you give slaves the illusion of freedom.
You were too easy on them.
If I'd had my way, we'd have secured shock collars on them years ago. The company's learned much since then.
The Empire can provide you with slave laborers for a small fee. They're quite cooperative.
We can arrange replacements.
As much as I'd love to throw my workers out, they have generations of experience. Too valuable to waste them all.
Your workers figure they'll be reduced to slaves once the Imps take over.
They're afraid of the Empire.
Preposterous, what would give them--? Anyway, fear is no excuse.
What about a compromise?
I'm done talking with them.
This sounds like your problem.
My company can't assist the Empire with production halted. But we have an idea.
The Board of Directors held a vote. We're unanimously calling for a workforce reduction. Eliminate a few, and the others will realize their mistake.
Horizon Enterprises has deep respect for the Sith Code, my lord. We'd be humbled if you would help us break our workers.
Horizon Enterprises needs someone with the skill set to carry out the extermin--let's call them "layoffs." To be honest, you're the perfect candidate.
Horizon Enterprises needs people with the strength necessary to execute the layoffs. To be frank, you're the perfect candidates.
I'll end their revolt.
Only if your company pays me.
I know a few people who don't deserve bonuses this year. I'll make the arrangements.
You're lucky I'm not busy.
We appreciate it. Really we do.
The workers are strong, upset and heavily armed--a violation of company policy. Please deal with them.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Rejection. I've heard of this.
Horizon Enterprises is proudly making the future possible today.
